books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the 1920s that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the Deep South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A futuristic society driven by technology and consumerism.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A satirical allegory about the Russian Revolution and totalitarianism.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel about love, class, and social expectations.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: The epic journey of Odysseus returning home after the Trojan War.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical tale about following one's dreams.

books.title: Of Mice and Men
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.description: A story of friendship and hardship during the Great Depression.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A sweeping narrative of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.description: The epic tale of the Trojan War and its heroes.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: A harrowing journey of a father and son in a post-apocalyptic world.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A scientist's creation turns into a monster in this gothic classic.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.description: A story of a family's struggle during the Great Depression.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A tragic love story set in 19th-century Russia.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: The classic tale of the vampire Count Dracula.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: A story of love and independence in Victorian England.

authors.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
authors.bio: American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

authors.name: Harper Lee
authors.bio: American novelist best known for her 1960 novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' which won the Pulitzer Prize.

authors.name: George Orwell
authors.bio: English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic, known for his works '1984' and 'Animal Farm.'

authors.name: Herman Melville
authors.bio: American novelist, short story writer, and poet of the American Renaissance period, best known for 'Moby Dick.'

authors.name: Aldous Huxley
authors.bio: English writer and philosopher, best known for his dystopian novel 'Brave New World.'

authors.name: Jane Austen
authors.bio: English novelist known for her six major novels, including 'Pride and Prejudice' and 'Sense and Sensibility.'

authors.name: J.D. Salinger
authors.bio: American writer best known for his novel 'The Catcher in the Rye.'

authors.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
authors.bio: Russian novelist, short story writer, essayist, and journalist, known for his works 'Crime and Punishment' and 'The Brothers Karamazov.'

authors.name: Homer
authors.bio: Ancient Greek poet traditionally said to be the author of the epic poems 'The Iliad' and 'The Odyssey.'

authors.name: Paulo Coelho
authors.bio: Brazilian lyricist and novelist, best known for his novel 'The Alchemist.'

authors.name: John Steinbeck
authors.bio: American author and Nobel Prize winner, known for his works 'Of Mice and Men' and 'The Grapes of Wrath.'

authors.name: Leo Tolstoy
authors.bio: Russian writer, regarded as one of the greatest authors of all time, known for 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina.'

authors.name: Bram Stoker
authors.bio: Irish author best known for his 1897 Gothic novel 'Dracula.'

authors.name: Emily Brontë
authors.bio: English novelist and poet, best known for her only novel 'Wuthering Heights.'

authors.name: Charlotte Brontë
authors.bio: English novelist and poet, the eldest of the three Brontë sisters, best known for 'Jane Eyre.'

authors.name: Mary Shelley
authors.bio: English novelist who wrote the Gothic novel 'Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus.'

authors.name: Cormac McCarthy
authors.bio: American novelist, playwright, and screenwriter, known for his works 'The Road' and 'No Country for Old Men.'
